30X.F.summary: Crayon Group Holding ASA, together with its subsidiaries, operates as an IT advisory company in software and digital transformation services. It operates through Software & Cloud Direct, Software & Cloud Channel, Software & Cloud Economics, and Consulting segments. The company provides assess and migrate services, including cloud migration assessment, maturity assessment, cloud infrastructure advisory and migration, cloud POC, cloud tenant migration, cloud connectivity, modern workplace migration, and cloud identity services; govern and optimize services comprising IT governance, license optimization, software and cloud economics, and SAM tool services; and operate and support services, such as modern workplace adoption, software and cloud advisory servicedesk, and support program services; and data platform and AI solutions services. It also offers software and IT asset management training services. The company has operations in the Nordics, Europe, the Asia-Pacific, the Middle East and Africa, and the United States. Crayon Group Holding ASA is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

4NK.F.summary: NORBIT ASA provides technology products and solutions. It operates through three segments: Oceans, Intelligent Traffic Systems, and Product Innovation & Realization. The company designs and develops wideband multibeam sonars used for hydrographic and forward-looking applications, as well as for detection of advanced subsea leakage; and provides cable assemblies, electromechanical box builds, and operational solutions. It also offers sensors and sensor platforms for monitoring, detection, and reporting tasks; SeaCOP software system for monitoring, detection, and emergency response for maritime and offshore operations; GuardPoint, a surveillance sonar used to detect underwater intruders; SafePoint that use to detect navigational obstacles; NORTrace, a software that simulates and graphs the underwater propagation of various sonar; and security solutions for defense. In addition, the company provides power underwater and suspended lights, as well as power cabinet and sensor solutions; and electronic manufacturing services, such as pure circuit board assembly, cable and wire harness, and fabrication of products and systems. Further, it offers DSRC 2G, a short-range communication device; VTM 745, a DSRC module for enforcement in GNSS based tolling; connectivity modules for smart tachographs; desktop readers; road side units; and reclosable fasteners. The company was founded in 1980 and is headquartered in Trondheim, Norway.

4W9.F.summary: Pexip Holding ASA, a technology company that delivers a video-first meeting platform. Its platform simplifies video communication across borders, businesses, and platforms, enabling everyone to be seen, heard, and included. The company offers self-hosted and as-a-service deployment options for enterprise video conferencing built on the Pexip Infinity technology; and provides interoperability, including Microsoft Teams, Skype for Business, Google Hangouts Gateway interop, video system device registration, and a world-class meeting and calling service. The company has operations in the Asia Pacific, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and the Americas. Pexip Holding ASA was founded in 2011 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

4ZW.F.summary: Zwipe AS provides biometric payment cards components and wearables technology that enable consumers to authorize transactions with their fingerprints without compromising their privacy. The company provides biometric payment platform, a solution for payment cards; biometric enrolment tablet for mobile registration and authentication of biometric cards by card issuers; and a wearable device for the tokenization of payment applications blended with biometrics. It operates in Norway and internationally. Zwipe AS has a collaboration with Idemia, a disruptive payment platform. The company was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

ARR.OL.summary: Arribatec Solutions ASA, a software and consulting company, provides digital business solutions in Norway and internationally. Its solutions include Unit4 that provides services for driving digitalization in platforms to deliver digital experiences; xledger, a cloud based ERP system; Hypergene that provides enterprise performance management services ; 4human, a software as a solution that delivers HRM solutions to corporate business, government and public services, retail, education, museums, construction, and other sectors; Power BI, a collection of tools and services that facilitates the acquisition of data, data modeling, visualizations, and reports, as well as the distribution of analytical solutions; RamBase, cloud based ERP solution for manufacturing and wholesale industries; Arribatec Instipro3, a research platform; and Arribatec Certify, an application for daily management of housekeeping department, including digitalized cleanliness, as well as inspection processes for rooms, and public and exhibition areas. The company was founded in 2015 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

ATEA.OL.summary: Atea ASA provides IT infrastructure and related solutions for businesses and public sector organizations in the Nordic countries and Baltic regions. The company offers hardware and software solutions for storing and managing information, as well as tools for virtualization, automation, and security for operating the data center environment; client hardware, software, and services to the requirements of users, applications, security, networks, and computing environments. It also provides hardware and software solutions for running networks, and services to help customers manage their communications; and a range of products to enable collaboration through conferencing, information sharing, and digital productivity solutions. In addition, it offers Device as a Service to various concepts, such as videoconferencing, digital signage, and networks. Atea ASA was founded in 1968 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

AYFIE.OL.summary: ayfie Group AS, a search company, provides knowledge discovery products and search solutions in the Nordics, Europe, and the United States. Its products are based on artificial intelligence enhanced solutions built on proprietary linguistics, machine learning, smart search, and text analytics. The company offers search and text analytics solutions for legal, compliance, finance, healthcare, and media. Its platform includes technologies from the fields of big data, insight engines, linguistic analysis, and content analytics. The company also provides text analytics solutions for eDiscovery, finance, publishing, and compliance. Its products include Locator for Knowledge Management that helps customers turn their corporate data into a true knowledge resource; Inspector that helps lawyers and others involved in litigation and investigations to identify the data important for their cases; and Document Analyzer that reads collections of documents to extract key information. The company's products are used by various industries ranging from construction companies to professional soccer clubs; and messaging and feature development focuses on serving law firms and legal service providers, as well as legal departments in corporations. It also offers service desk and knowledge base services. The company is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

B1T.F.summary: Techstep ASA provides digital workplace services in Norway and Sweden. It offers mobile hardware, service, support, and mobility consultancy services; software as a service, as well as mobile expense management modules; and financing and remarketing services. The company also provides industry-leading cloud-based PBX solutions and enterprise mobility management services, including mobile security, system design, implementation, and mobile device management. In addition, it develops and provides enterprise mobility software and solutions for the customers in the transportation, logistics, and public safety sectors. The company is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

B7X.F.summary: Thin Film Electronics ASA designs, develops, and produces ultrathin energy storage solutions for wearable devices, connected sensors, and other applications. Its solid-state lithium battery technology enables it to produce rechargeable batteries with high energy densities and long product lifetimes. The company was founded in 2005 is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

B7Z.F.summary: Arribatec Solutions ASA, a software and consulting company, provides digital business solutions in Norway and internationally. Its solutions include Unit4 that provides services for driving digitalization in platforms to deliver digital experiences; xledger, a cloud based ERP system; Hypergene that provides enterprise performance management services ; 4human, a software as a solution that delivers HRM solutions to corporate business, government and public services, retail, education, museums, construction, and other sectors; Power BI, a collection of tools and services that facilitates the acquisition of data, data modeling, visualizations, and reports, as well as the distribution of analytical solutions; RamBase, cloud based ERP solution for manufacturing and wholesale industries; Arribatec Instipro3, a research platform; and Arribatec Certify, an application for daily management of housekeeping department, including digitalized cleanliness, as well as inspection processes for rooms, and public and exhibition areas. The company was founded in 2015 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

BOUV.OL.summary: Bouvet ASA provides information technology, digital communication, and enterprise management services in Norway, Sweden, and internationally. The company designs, develops, and provides advisory services on IT solutions and digital communication. Bouvet ASA was founded in 2002 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

BV4.F.summary: Bouvet ASA provides information technology, digital communication, and enterprise management services in Norway, Sweden, and internationally. The company designs, develops, and provides advisory services on IT solutions and digital communication. Bouvet ASA was founded in 2002 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

CRAYN.OL.summary: Crayon Group Holding ASA, together with its subsidiaries, operates as an IT advisory company in software and digital transformation services. It operates through Software & Cloud Direct, Software & Cloud Channel, Software & Cloud Economics, and Consulting segments. The company provides assess and migrate services, including cloud migration assessment, maturity assessment, cloud infrastructure advisory and migration, cloud POC, cloud tenant migration, cloud connectivity, modern workplace migration, and cloud identity services; govern and optimize services comprising IT governance, license optimization, software and cloud economics, and SAM tool services; and operate and support services, such as modern workplace adoption, software and cloud advisory servicedesk, and support program services; and data platform and AI solutions services. It also offers software and IT asset management training services. The company has operations in the Nordics, Europe, the Asia-Pacific, the Middle East and Africa, and the United States. Crayon Group Holding ASA is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

CYVIZ.OL.summary: Cyviz AS manufactures and sells products for conference rooms, control rooms and experience centers. The company offers Easy platform, a comprehensive platform for room control and management; and Easy server application that offers remote management, support, configuration, diagnosing, and software upgrades. It also provides Easy controller software on the touch controller unit; control system that orchestrates the underlying technology and integrates industry standard components and services for interoperability across Enterprise favored video- and unified communication platforms; and Easy Connect that allows to connect and share content, as well as display solutions. The company was incorporated in 1992 and is based in Sandnes, Norway.

ECO.OL.summary: EcoOnline Holding AS, a software-as-a-service solutions company, engages in the development of cloud-based software solutions for the chemical, health, safety, environment, and quality management applications in the workplaces. Its products include Chemical Manager, a cloud-based software tool for the management of chemical safety; and EcoOnline EHS software, an occupational safety solution. The company also provides services, such as safety data sheet authoring, dangerous goods safety advisory, chemical regulatory compliance, health and safety consultancy, and training; and chemical labels e-shop that supplies chemical and hazardous material labels. It has operations in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Ireland, the United Kingdom, and the United States. The company was founded in 2000 and is headquartered in TÃ¸nsberg, Norway.

EIP.MU.summary: Elliptic Laboratories A/S provides software-based artificial intelligence (AI) virtual smart sensors in Norway, China, South Korea, the United States, and Japan. It offers AI virtual sensors, such as security, inner beauty proximity, gesture; presence, and connection sensors for laptops, mobiles, and IoT and VR devices. The company was founded in 2006 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

ELABS.OL.summary: Elliptic Laboratories A/S provides software-based artificial intelligence (AI) virtual smart sensors in Norway, China, South Korea, the United States, and Japan. It offers AI virtual sensors, such as security, inner beauty proximity, gesture; presence, and connection sensors for laptops, mobiles, and IoT and VR devices. The company was founded in 2006 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

ELIMP.OL.summary: ElektroimportÃ¸ren AS, together with its subsidiaries, sells electro materials and related products to private and professional customers. It offers lighting products, cables, and heating and ventilation products. The company sells products through department stores and e-commerce. As of December 31, 2020, it operated 23 department stores. The company was founded in 1994 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

ELOP.OL.summary: Elop AS, a technology company, develops and sells advanced tools, applications, and software solutions for inspection, monitoring, and management of concrete structures in Norway and internationally. It offers Elop Insight, a rolling ultrasonic scanning solution for the inspection of concrete structures, such as bridges, dams, tunnels, and buildings. The company was incorporated in 2013 and is headquartered in Hamar, Norway.

FLYR.OL.summary: Flyr AS focuses on operating an airline in Norway. It intends to offer customers with domestic and international flights from its base at Oslo Airport. The company was incorporated in 2020 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

HDLY.OL.summary: Huddly AS, a technology company, creates tools for team collaboration in Norway and the United States. The company provides meeting room cameras under the Huddly GO and Huddly IQ names; whiteboard cameras under the Huddly Canvas name; and accessories, such as mounting brackets, room cables, and extension cables. It also offers Huddly ONE, a camera kit that delivers Full HD and wide-angle video meetings from desktop and laptop, as well as operates Huddly app. The company was founded in 2013 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

HOC.OL.summary: House Of Control Group AS develops and sells software as a service (SaaS) solutions within the areas of finance and accounting in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, and internationally. The company offers Complete Control, a cloud-based SaaS solution, which is used for managing contracts and assets, including the contracts' financial implications for accounting, budgeting, and reporting; IFRS 16 Compliance that is for assisting companies in complying with IFRS 16 requirements; and Complete Procure, which is organization's own web shop, where employees purchase at a lower cost, paperwork is automatic, and the supplier does the routine work. It also offers Digital Signature, a verified digital identity solution; Security labels, which are used for safeguard PCs and other equipment; Authority Matrix, a user-friendly cloud application that shows who has the authority to do what and it is easy to update; Supplier Portal, a sustainable and smart fix to keep down complexity and work-load when the number of suppliers grow; Supplier Invoice, a turbo for IFS users, making invoice management better and more efficient; and Effectplan, a budgeting and forecasting tool that enables you to easily and accurately create, manage, and modify the budget. The company was founded in 2013 and is headquartered at HÃ¸vik, Norway.

HOG.MU.summary: House Of Control Group AS develops and sells software as a service (SaaS) solutions within the areas of finance and accounting in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, and internationally. The company offers Complete Control, a cloud-based SaaS solution, which is used for managing contracts and assets, including the contracts' financial implications for accounting, budgeting, and reporting; IFRS 16 Compliance that is for assisting companies in complying with IFRS 16 requirements; and Complete Procure, which is organization's own web shop, where employees purchase at a lower cost, paperwork is automatic, and the supplier does the routine work. The company was founded in 2013 and is headquartered at HÃ¸vik, Norway.

HSCNF.summary: House Of Control Group AS develops and sells software as a service (SaaS) solutions within the areas of finance and accounting in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, and internationally. The company offers Complete Control, a cloud-based SaaS solution, which is used for managing contracts and assets, including the contracts' financial implications for accounting, budgeting, and reporting; IFRS 16 Compliance that is for assisting companies in complying with IFRS 16 requirements; and Complete Procure, which is organization's own web shop, where employees purchase at a lower cost, paperwork is automatic, and the supplier does the routine work. It also offers Digital Signature, a verified digital identity solution; Security labels, which are used for safeguard PCs and other equipment; Authority Matrix, a user-friendly cloud application that shows who has the authority to do what and it is easy to update; Supplier Portal, a sustainable and smart fix to keep down complexity and work-load when the number of suppliers grow; Supplier Invoice, a turbo for IFS users, making invoice management better and more efficient; and Effectplan, a budgeting and forecasting tool that enables you to easily and accurately create, manage, and modify the budget. The company was founded in 2013 and is headquartered at HÃ¸vik, Norway.

HUDL.OL.summary: Huddlestock Fintech As, a financial technology company, provides end-to-end asset management solutions. It offers digital onboarding, and real-time trading and updates. The company is based in Stavanger, Norway.

I8X.F.summary: IDEX Biometrics ASA engages in the design, development, and sale of fingerprint identification and authentication solutions in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, the Americas, and Asia. The company offers IDEX Biometrics for the biometrics smart card market, including biometric fingerprint sensors for use in dual interface, contactless only, and contact only smart cards; biometric fingerprint modules for contact based smart cards; and on-card enrollment solutions for remote in-person enrollment. It primarily serves biometric payment card market, as well as offers its products and solutions for other markets, including access control, identification, healthcare, and the Internet of Things. The company was formerly known as Idex ASA and changed its name to IDEX Biometrics ASA in May 2019. IDEX Biometrics ASA was incorporated in 1996 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

IDBA.summary: IDEX Biometrics ASA engages in the design, development, and sale of fingerprint identification and authentication solutions in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, the Americas, and Asia. The company offers IDEX Biometrics for the biometrics smart card market, including biometric fingerprint sensors for use in dual interface, contactless only, and contact only smart cards; biometric fingerprint modules for contact based smart cards; and on-card enrollment solutions for remote in-person enrollment. It primarily serves biometric payment card market, as well as offers its products and solutions for other markets, including access control, identification, healthcare, and the Internet of Things. The company was formerly known as Idex ASA and changed its name to IDEX Biometrics ASA in May 2019. IDEX Biometrics ASA was incorporated in 1996 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

IDEX.OL.summary: IDEX Biometrics ASA engages in the design, development, and sale of fingerprint identification and authentication solutions in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, the Americas, and Asia. The company offers IDEX Biometrics for the biometrics smart card market, including biometric fingerprint sensors for use in dual interface, contactless only, and contact only smart cards; biometric fingerprint modules for contact based smart cards; and on-card enrollment solutions for remote in-person enrollment. It primarily serves biometric payment card market, as well as offers its products and solutions for other markets, including access control, identification, healthcare, and the Internet of Things. The company was formerly known as Idex ASA and changed its name to IDEX Biometrics ASA in May 2019. IDEX Biometrics ASA was incorporated in 1996 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

IDXAF.summary: IDEX Biometrics ASA engages in the design, development, and sale of fingerprint identification and authentication solutions in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, the Americas, and Asia. The company offers IDEX Biometrics for the biometrics smart card market, including biometric fingerprint sensors for use in dual interface, contactless only, and contact only smart cards; biometric fingerprint modules for contact based smart cards; and on-card enrollment solutions for remote in-person enrollment. It primarily serves biometric payment card market, as well as offers its products and solutions for other markets, including access control, identification, healthcare, and the Internet of Things. The company was formerly known as Idex ASA and changed its name to IDEX Biometrics ASA in May 2019. IDEX Biometrics ASA was incorporated in 1996 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

INFRO.OL.summary: Infront ASA provides market data, trading solutions, and news for finance professionals and private investors in Norway, Sweden, and internationally. The company offers the Infront Professional terminal, a terminal that provides real-time market data, news, analytics, and electronic trading within the financial markets; Infront Analytics platform, which offers fundamental analysis, combined with business valuation and equity analysis tools; Infront Investment Manager to access its cloud-based products and market data; solutions for investor relations professionals and treasury needs; Infront Data, an internal provider of data on market expectations and company information; retail trading solutions; and news agency services. It also provides solutions for portfolio and advisory, regulatory and calculation, data and feeds, and publication and distribution; and analysis tool for the financial markets with chart analytics, fundamental analytics, and portfolio management, as well as operates securities trading centers. In addition, it offers a range of stock exchange data from Moscow, Frankfurt am Main, Zurich, London, New York, Chicago, Sydney, and Tokyo. The company was founded in 1998 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

ITERA.OL.summary: Itera ASA, together with its subsidiaries, designs, develops, and operates digital solutions for companies and organizations in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Slovakia, and Ukraine. It delivers projects and services in the consulting and strategy, design and development, and operations and management areas. The company also provides strategic advisory, design and development, and managed cloud services, as well as hosting and operations, and infrastructure services. It primarily serves clients in insurance, banking and finance, high tech, energy, media, and public sectors. Itera ASA was founded in 1989 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

KAHOT.OL.summary: Kahoot! ASA operates a game-based learning platform in the United States, Canada, Europe, the Asia Pacific, the Latin America and the Caribbean, Africa, the Middle East, and India. The company's platforms help to create, share, and play learning games. It offers Kahoot! Learning platform for learning and engagement services; Actimo, an employee engagement platform which connects and engages Organizations work teams; Drops, a language learning app for visuals and play; Kahoot! DragonBox app for math learning; and Kahoot! Poio Read app, which empowers children to learn to read through play. The company also provides Kahoot! Academy, a knowledge platform and online community, which allows educators and publishers to share and access content that supports engaging and meaningful learning experiences for learners; Kahoot! 360 a powerful and collaborative platform for organizations that seek to connect teams and individuals; Kahoot! EDU for schools, enabling the administrators and school leaders; and Kahoot!+ Family, which offers families a set of tools and apps to help them learn at home. Further, it develops an application for Zoom, which enabling its users to access, host and play Kahoot! games directly from Zoom Meetings. The company has approximately 1.5 billion participating players in approximately 200 countries. Kahoot! ASA was founded in 2012 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

KHOTF.summary: Kahoot! AS operates a game-based learning platform in the United States, Canada, Europe, the Asia Pacific, the Latin America and the Caribbean, Africa, the Middle East, and India. The company's platforms help to create, share, and play learning games. It offers Kahoot! Learning platform for learning and engagement services; Actimo, an employee engagement platform which connects and engages Organizations work teams; Drops, a language learning app for visuals and play; Kahoot! DragonBox app for math learning; and Kahoot! Poio Read app, which empowers children to learn to read through play. The company also provides Kahoot! Academy, a knowledge platform and online community, which allows educators and publishers to share and access content that supports engaging and meaningful learning experiences for learners; Kahoot! 360 a powerful and collaborative platform for organizations that seek to connect teams and individuals; Kahoot! EDU for schools, enabling the administrators and school leaders; and Kahoot!+ Family, which offers families a set of tools and apps to help them learn at home. Further, it develops an application for Zoom, which enabling its users to access, host and play Kahoot! games directly from Zoom Meetings. The company has approximately 1.5 billion participating players in approximately 200 countries. Kahoot! AS was founded in 2012 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

MKL.F.summary: Atea ASA provides IT infrastructure and related solutions for businesses and public sector organizations in the Nordic countries and Baltic regions. The company offers hardware and software solutions for storing and managing information, as well as tools for virtualization, automation, and security for operating the data center environment; client hardware, software, and services to the requirements of users, applications, security, networks, and computing environments. It also provides hardware and software solutions for running networks, and services to help customers manage their communications; and a range of products to enable collaboration through conferencing, information sharing, and digital productivity solutions. In addition, it offers Device as a Service to various concepts, such as videoconferencing, digital signage, and networks. Atea ASA was founded in 1968 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

MRCEL.OL.summary: Mercell Holding AS provides eTendering, tender notification, and bid manager solutions through online marketplace in Nordic region. The company's Software as a Service system allows public buyers to manage the whole tender process in full compliance with EU directives and national legislation for conducting electronic tender processes. The company also offers eProcurement solutions in the postaward market, including eCommerce/eCatalogues, invoicing and payment services, and spend analysis. Mercell Holding AS was founded in 1999 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

N0S.F.summary: Nordic Semiconductor ASA, a fabless semiconductor company, designs, develops, markets, and sells integrated circuits, systems, and solutions for short- and long-range wireless applications in Europe, the Americas, and the Asia/Pacific. The company specializes in ultra-low power components, based on its proprietary 2.4 GHz RF, Bluetooth low energy, and LTE-M and NB- Internet of Things (IoT); and develops low power cellular IoT. It also provides Bluetooth 5 solutions; low power cellular devices for the IoT; and Bluetooth 5.1 solutions for direction finding applications. In addition, the company offers Zigbee 3.0 IoT solutions; Thread solution for low-power IEEE 802.15.4 devices; nRF9160 system-in-package; nRF52 and nRF51 series system-on-chips, and nRF591, nRF53, nRF52, and nRF51 series software development kits; ANT, a proprietary ultra-low power wireless solution for battery operated products; and application specific integrated circuits and related consulting services. Further, it provides software for system development, communication stacks, and application layer software, as well as development tools for desktops, mobiles, and clouds. The company's products are used in various applications, such as audio, automotive, beacon, computer peripherals, drug delivery, disease monitoring and test, smart home, healthcare, connected health and home, education, industrial automation, LED lighting, logistics/asset tracking, transportation, retail and payment, sports and fitness, toys and gaming, virtual reality and augmented reality products, remote control, metering, PC and tablet accessories, mobile phone accessories, building and retail, and consumer electronics, as well as wearables, including connected watches, jewelry, proximity tags, and smart clothes and apparels. Nordic Semiconductor ASA was founded in 1983 and is headquartered in Trondheim, Norway.

NDCVF.summary: Nordic Semiconductor ASA, a fabless semiconductor company, designs, develops, markets, and sells integrated circuits, systems, and solutions for short- and long-range wireless applications in Europe, the Americas, and the Asia/Pacific. The company specializes in ultra-low power components, based on its proprietary 2.4 GHz RF, Bluetooth low energy, and LTE-M and NB- Internet of Things (IoT); and develops low power cellular IoT. It also provides Bluetooth 5 solutions; low power cellular devices for the IoT; and Bluetooth 5.1 solutions for direction finding applications. In addition, the company offers Zigbee 3.0 IoT solutions; Thread solution for low-power IEEE 802.15.4 devices; nRF9160 system-in-package; nRF52 and nRF51 series system-on-chips, and nRF591, nRF53, nRF52, and nRF51 series software development kits; ANT, a proprietary ultra-low power wireless solution for battery operated products; and application specific integrated circuits and related consulting services. Further, it provides software for system development, communication stacks, and application layer software, as well as development tools for desktops, mobiles, and clouds. The company's products are used in various applications, such as audio, automotive, beacon, computer peripherals, drug delivery, disease monitoring and test, smart home, healthcare, connected health and home, education, industrial automation, LED lighting, logistics/asset tracking, transportation, retail and payment, sports and fitness, toys and gaming, virtual reality and augmented reality products, remote control, metering, PC and tablet accessories, mobile phone accessories, building and retail, and consumer electronics, as well as wearables, including connected watches, jewelry, proximity tags, and smart clothes and apparels. Nordic Semiconductor ASA was founded in 1983 and is headquartered in Trondheim, Norway.

NEXT.OL.summary: NEXT Biometrics Group ASA, through its subsidiaries, engages in the research, development, manufacture, and commercialization of fingerprint technology and products in Asia. The company offers fingerprint sensor modules and readers, and flexible biometric subassemblies, as well as software and hardware development kits for USB and SPI modules. Its products are used in smart card, government ID, access control, and notebook applications. The company sells its sensors to distributors of electronic components. NEXT Biometrics Group ASA is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

NOD.OL.summary: Nordic Semiconductor ASA, a fabless semiconductor company, designs, develops, markets, and sells integrated circuits, systems, and solutions for short- and long-range wireless applications in Europe, the Americas, and the Asia/Pacific. The company specializes in ultra-low power components, based on its proprietary 2.4 GHz RF, Bluetooth low energy, and LTE-M and NB- Internet of Things (IoT); and develops low power cellular IoT. It also provides Bluetooth 5 solutions; low power cellular devices for the IoT; and Bluetooth 5.1 solutions for direction finding applications. Further, it provides software for system development, communication stacks, and application layer software, as well as development tools for desktops, mobiles, and clouds. The company's products are used in various applications, such as audio, automotive, beacon, computer peripherals, drug delivery, disease monitoring and test, smart home, healthcare, connected health and home, education, industrial automation, LED lighting, logistics/asset tracking, transportation, retail and payment, sports and fitness, toys and gaming, virtual reality and augmented reality products, remote control, metering, PC and tablet accessories, mobile phone accessories, building and retail, and consumer electronics, as well as wearables, including connected watches, jewelry, proximity tags, and smart clothes and apparels. Nordic Semiconductor ASA was founded in 1983 and is headquartered in Trondheim, Norway.

NORBT.OL.summary: NORBIT ASA provides technology products and solutions. It operates through three segments: Oceans, Intelligent Traffic Systems, and Product Innovation & Realization. The company designs and develops wideband multibeam sonars used for hydrographic and forward-looking applications, as well as for detection of advanced subsea leakage; and provides cable assemblies, electromechanical box builds, and operational solutions. It also offers sensors and sensor platforms for monitoring, detection, and reporting tasks; SeaCOP software system for monitoring, detection, and emergency response for maritime and offshore operations; GuardPoint, a surveillance sonar used to detect underwater intruders; SafePoint that use to detect navigational obstacles; NORTrace, a software that simulates and graphs the underwater propagation of various sonar; and security solutions for defense. In addition, the company provides power underwater and suspended lights, as well as power cabinet and sensor solutions; and electronic manufacturing services, such as pure circuit board assembly, cable and wire harness, and fabrication of products and systems. Further, it offers DSRC 2G, a short-range communication device; VTM 745, a DSRC module for enforcement in GNSS based tolling; connectivity modules for smart tachographs; desktop readers; road side units; and reclosable fasteners. The company was founded in 1980 and is headquartered in Trondheim, Norway.

OPRA.summary: Opera Limited, together with its subsidiaries, provides mobile and PC web browsers. The company offers mobile browser products, such as Opera Mini, Opera for Android, and Opera Touch; PC browsers, including Opera for Computers and Opera GX; Opera News, a personalized news aggregation app; and Okash, a microfinance app. It operates in India, Ireland, Kenya, Russia, and internationally. The company was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway. As of January 13, 2021, Opera Limited (NasdaqGS : OPRA) operates as subsidiary of Kunlun Tech Limited.

ORN.OL.summary: Orn Software Holding AS provides software as a service solutions for the industrial, facility, and property operations, maintenance, and management for various industries primarily in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, and Iceland. The company's products include ServiceBook, a solution to digitalize operations and facility inspections; Maintenance, a solution for industrial maintenance management; InControl, a system for internal control; Uni, a property and facility management solution for commercial and residential properties; Energy, an energy management system; Optima, a tool for operational decision-making; and Main Manager, a facility management system. It also provides solutions for real estate, manufacturing, food and beverage, and aquaculture industries, as well as for energy and environmental management systems. The company is headquartered in Trondheim, Norway.

PEXIP.OL.summary: Pexip Holding ASA, a technology company that delivers a video-first meeting platform. Its platform simplifies video communication across borders, businesses, and platforms, enabling everyone to be seen, heard, and included. The company offers self-hosted and as-a-service deployment options for enterprise video conferencing built on the Pexip Infinity technology; and provides interoperability, including Microsoft Teams, Skype for Business, Google Hangouts Gateway interop, video system device registration, and a world-class meeting and calling service. The company has operations in the Asia Pacific, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and the Americas. Pexip Holding ASA was founded in 2011 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

PLT.OL.summary: poLight ASA develops photographic lens for consumer devices and industrial applications. Its lens replicates the lens of the human eye enabling the implementation of autofocus functions for various applications. The company's product portfolio includes Tunable Optical Lens (TLens) products for front and back camera phones; wearables, including AR/VR devices; tablet PCs; HD video cameras; drones; handheld devices; and barcode readers, as well for industry applications, such as medical and retail. It also offers ASIC drivers that control the supply of variable voltage to TLens products and makes them to change focus. It has operations in Europe, Asia, and the United States. poLight ASA was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Horten, Norway.

PMG.OL.summary: Play Magnus AS operates in the chess industry worldwide. The company engages in the development of chess related applications, content, and events. It offers e-learning and entertainment services under the chess24, Chessable, CoChess, iChess, the Play Magnus App Suite, and the Champions Chess Tour brands. It also organizes chess competitions through online. Play Magnus AS was founded in 2013 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

PMGMF.summary: Play Magnus AS operates in the chess industry worldwide. The company engages in the development of chess related applications, content, and events. It offers e-learning and entertainment services under the chess24, Chessable, CoChess, iChess, the Play Magnus App Suite, and the Champions Chess Tour brands. It also organizes chess competitions through online. Play Magnus AS was founded in 2013 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

PXPHF.summary: Pexip Holding ASA, a technology company that delivers a video-first meeting platform. Its platform simplifies video communication across borders, businesses, and platforms, enabling everyone to be seen, heard, and included. The company offers self-hosted and as-a-service deployment options for enterprise video conferencing built on the Pexip Infinity technology; and provides interoperability, including Microsoft Teams, Skype for Business, Google Hangouts Gateway interop, video system device registration, and a world-class meeting and calling service. The company has operations in the Asia Pacific, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and the Americas. Pexip Holding ASA was founded in 2011 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

R3Q.F.summary: REC Silicon ASA, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells silicon materials for the solar and electronics industries worldwide. It offers various solar grade polysilicon for solar applications, including granular polysilicon, siemens rod sections, chunks, chips, and fines. The company also provides electronic grade polysilicon comprising TearDrop, as-grown siemens rods, rod sections, chunks, and chips for use in Czochralski monocrystalline ingot/wafer manufacturing for the semiconductor industry, as well as other electronic market segments, such as optics and microelectromechanical systems; and float zone polysilicon. In addition, it offers silicon gases consisting of silane, dichlorosilane, monochlorosilane, disilane, and polysilanes. The company was formerly known as Renewable Energy Corporation ASA and changed its name to REC Silicon ASA in October 2013. REC Silicon ASA was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway.

RECSI.OL.summary: REC Silicon ASA, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells silicon materials for the solar and electronics industries worldwide. It offers various solar grade polysilicon for solar applications, including granular polysilicon, siemens rod sections, chunks, chips, and fines. The company also provides electronic grade polysilicon comprising TearDrop, as-grown siemens rods, rod sections, chunks, and chips for use in Czochralski monocrystalline ingot/wafer manufacturing for the semiconductor industry, as well as other electronic market segments, such as optics and microelectromechanical systems; and float zone polysilicon. The company was formerly known as Renewable Energy Corporation ASA and changed its name to REC Silicon ASA in October 2013. REC Silicon ASA was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway.

The company was formerly known as Renewable Energy Corporation ASA and changed its name to REC Silicon ASA in October 2013. REC Silicon ASA was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway.

RNWEY.summary: REC Silicon ASA, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells silicon materials for the solar and electronics industries worldwide. It offers various solar grade polysilicon for solar applications, including granular polysilicon, siemens rod sections, chunks, chips, and fines. The company also provides electronic grade polysilicon comprising TearDrop, as-grown siemens rods, rod sections, chunks, and chips for use in Czochralski monocrystalline ingot/wafer manufacturing for the semiconductor industry, as well as other electronic market segments, such as optics and microelectromechanical systems; and float zone polysilicon. In addition, it offers silicon gases consisting of silane, dichlorosilane, monochlorosilane, disilane, and polysilanes. The company was formerly known as Renewable Energy Corporation ASA and changed its name to REC Silicon ASA in October 2013. REC Silicon ASA was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway.

SIKRI.OL.summary: Sikri Holding AS provides case processing, and document management and archiving solutions to the public sector in Norway. Its products include Elements Sak-Arkiv, a case archive system for the management of public services; Elements eByggesak, a case management tool specially adapted for construction case processing; and Elements RiskManager, an electronic quality system that supports the business with quality and management processes, non-conformance management, notifications, and risk assessments for both the public and private sectors. The company's products also comprise Elements Cloud that supports external login, as well as integrates login solutions in the market, such as ADFS and SAML-based identity solutions; and Elements Lekdommer, a web-based solution for municipalities in connection with the election, updating, and exemption treatment of co-judges in the district court and co-judges and storage members in the storage court. In addition, it offers courses and training, consulting, and support, as well as provides personal counseling of key resources. The company was founded in 2000 and is based in Lysaker, Norway.

SKI.OL.summary: Skitude Holding AS provides digital and mobile platforms for the monitoring, gamification, and sharing of skiing, snowboarding, and other outdoor activity experiences. It connects skiers and outdoor enthusiasts with mountain resorts through a range of smartphone apps, access to ski resorts through Skitude Instant Access, and the purchase of ski passes and other ski resort services. The company was founded in 2016 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

TECH.OL.summary: Techstep ASA provides digital workplace services in Norway and Sweden. It offers mobile hardware, service, support, and mobility consultancy services; software as a service, as well as mobile expense management modules; and financing and remarketing services. The company also provides industry-leading cloud-based PBX solutions and enterprise mobility management services, including mobile security, system design, implementation, and mobile device management. In addition, it develops and provides enterprise mobility software and solutions for the customers in the transportation, logistics, and public safety sectors. The company is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

TFECF.summary: Thin Film Electronics ASA designs, develops, and produces ultrathin energy storage solutions for wearable devices, connected sensors, and other applications. Its solid-state lithium battery technology enables it to produce rechargeable batteries with high energy densities and long product lifetimes. The company was founded in 2005 is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

TFECY.summary: Thin Film Electronics ASA designs, develops, and produces ultrathin energy storage solutions for wearable devices, connected sensors, and other applications. Its solid-state lithium battery technology enables it to produce rechargeable batteries with high energy densities and long product lifetimes. The company was founded in 2005 is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

THIN.OL.summary: Thin Film Electronics ASA designs, develops, and produces ultrathin energy storage solutions for wearable devices, connected sensors, and other applications. Its solid-state lithium battery technology enables it to produce rechargeable batteries with high energy densities and long product lifetimes. The company was founded in 2005 is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

VOLUE.OL.summary: Volue AS provides software and technology solutions for the energy, power grid, and infrastructure markets worldwide. It operates in three segments: Energy, Power Grid, and Infrastructure. The Energy segment enables end-to-end optimization of the green energy value-chain by offering software solutions and consulting services related to forecasting and optimization of the different energy markets. The Power Grid segment enables power distributors to support electrification of society by unlocking flexibility and digital management of the power grid. This segment also offers software solutions and consulting services. The Infrastructure segment delivers flexible solutions for digital water management consisting of software solutions and consulting services. This segment also automates processes and machines for the construction industry. It also provides solutions for the water supply, transport, offshore, maritime, and defense industries. The company was founded in 2019 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway. Volue AS is a subsidiary of Arendals Fossekompani ASA.

WSTEP.OL.summary: Webstep ASA, together with its subsidiaries, provides information technology (IT) consultancy services to public and private businesses in Norway and Sweden. The company offers digitalization, cloud migration and integration, Internet of Things, machine learning, IT security, robotics, and analytics. Its services include tech advisory and management solutions; consulting, digitalization, .Net, Java, open source, front and back end, user experience, integration, mobility, machine learning, business intelligence, big data, data warehousing, virtual robotics, Devops, application service management, and data science services; and cloud computing, integration, sensor technology, product and service development, Beacons, enterprise user experience, web analysis, designing, Amazon Web, Azure, prediction, AI, predictive modelling, hackathon, business analysis, and search engine optimization services. The company serves banking, finance and insurance, public administration, agriculture and food production, IT and telecommunication, commerce, and transportation industries. The company was founded in 2000 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

ZWIPE.OL.summary: Zwipe AS provides biometric payment cards components and wearables technology that enable consumers to authorize transactions with their fingerprints without compromising their privacy. The company provides biometric payment platform, a solution for payment cards; biometric enrolment tablet for mobile registration and authentication of biometric cards by card issuers; and a wearable device for the tokenization of payment applications blended with biometrics. It operates in Norway and internationally. Zwipe AS has a collaboration with Idemia, a disruptive payment platform. The company was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

ZWIPE.ST.summary: Zwipe AS provides biometric payment cards components and wearables technology that enable consumers to authorize transactions with their fingerprints without compromising their privacy. The company provides biometric payment platform, a solution for payment cards; biometric enrolment tablet for mobile registration and authentication of biometric cards by card issuers; and a wearable device for the tokenization of payment applications blended with biometrics. It operates in Norway and internationally. Zwipe AS has a collaboration with Idemia, a disruptive payment platform. The company was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.
